roy-etal-2021-identifying.title: Identifying Morality Frames in Political Tweets using Relational Learning
roy-etal-2021-identifying.author:
Roy, Shamik  and
Pacheco, Maria Leonor  and
Goldwasser, Dan
roy-etal-2021-identifying.paperMotivationText: Moral sentiment is often motivated by its targets, i.e. individuals or collective entities.
roy-etal-2021-identifying.paperContributionText: The authors introduce morality frames, a representation framework for organizing moral attitudes directed at different entities. They also propose an annotated dataset of tweets written by US politicians. Lastly, they propose a model to predict moral attitudes.
roy-etal-2021-identifying.paperResultsText: Moral sentiment towards entities differs highly across political ideologies.
roy-etal-2021-identifying.resourcesOtherText: Twitter corpus by Johnson and Goldwasser (2018), Congress of Tweets https://github.com/alexlitel/congresstweets
